not-completed.text: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
not-completed.author: Karen Lamb

not-completed.text: Well done is better than well said.
not-completed.author: Benjamin Franklin

not-completed.text: Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.
not-completed.author: David Allen
not-completed.note: creator of GTD, Getting Things Done

not-completed.text: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
not-completed.author: Peter Drucker

not-completed.text: Focus on being productive instead of busy.
not-completed.author: Tim Ferriss

not-completed.text: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
not-completed.author: Henry Ford

not-completed.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
not-completed.author: Walt Disney

not-completed.text: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration. The rest of us just get up and go to work.
not-completed.author: Stephen King

not-completed.text: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
not-completed.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

not-completed.text: You don’t need more time, you just need to decide.
not-completed.author: Seth Godin

not-completed.text: I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by.
not-completed.author: Douglas Adams

not-completed.text: Why procrastinate now when you can put it off until later?
not-completed.author: Unknown

not-completed.text: My to-do list is like a never-ending story... of unfinished tasks.
not-completed.author: Unknown

not-completed.text: I always give 100% at work: 13% Monday, 22% Tuesday, 26% Wednesday, 35% Thursday, and 4% Friday.
not-completed.author: Unknown
